review_text: Thanks Amazon for the freedom sale or else I would never have considered to buy these headphones.
Comfortable to wear.
Pros
-First of all it is not worth the price

I am ok in this special edition, its not up to the original branded value... also phone calls are unclear... many times I used to avoid headphones for calls... battery performance is good as compared to main edition of 4.5 BT SERIES. For high bass songs sound quality is not good..

this heeadphone work perfectly with mobile phones but problem with laptop . If you want to buy Sennheiser HD 4.50,  I suggest you  to buy original not special edition. I am tying special edition 2 times. all the times have same issues,, beware friends.

Can't wear it more than 2 hours at a stretch or so, sometimes it becomes uncomfortable on ears & feels heavy. The sound is not very great as per price but it's good enough. Noise activation is difficult to activate on Bluetooth mode and easy on wired. Battery life is good, I charge it weekly.

I have bought this product on 24 October 2018. Till now its work good but now for no reason its not working, first of all it stuck on ON state, no function is working in it. I tried to switch off it but that is not working either. So i connect it to laptop to switch off it. i thought it will work after getting off than i tried to ON it but now its look like its dead. and the main thing i haven't notice when i bought this is that there is no service center in Delhi, i have to travel to Gurgaon to repair it........

I liked it when I got an almost ₹15K (₹14990) product at 50% Off in one of the Sales and icing on the cake was another 10% instant cashback. So, practically the product cost me ₹6741/- only. The HD 4.40 is available in ₹7.5K anyways. The only improved or additional feature that company talks about is Noise Cancellation, which is missing in HD 4.40. When you are listening to Music, the NC feature still works fine, but, during calls the Noise Cancellation feature doesn't works at all in noisy backgrounds. You literally have to remove the headset and shout out in the mic of the headset for the person to hear what you are talking. Battery is awesome. I am saying that as I have used the headset majorly for listening music while i am commuting. It has given me more than a weeks runtime at time. But, i believe if you use it continuously, it should give you atleast 2 days of run time. Durability wise I had read in some other review that the cushions are not great for long music sessions. Somewhat that statement is correct. The headphones start hurting if you wear it for too long. In my personal experience, it makes the section around your ears warm (probably because they are covered and no ventilation is happening) and starts sweating after around 15 mins of continuous music listening. The logo prints on the sides were printed so shallow that they vanished after around 2 months on usage.

The overall product quality and sound is excellent...But the authenticity of the product is questionable since its packaged in a brown coloured box with a qr code from Appario Retail Private Ltd instead of the Senheiser branded box...Can anyone help me regarding this?

Very worst prouct from Sennheiser. Didnt expect such kind of quality. Its not compatible with all devices. Its not comfortable to wear for long. No good bass or no better clear sound. Except noise cancellation nothing it has got. Sound quality is worse than my other normal earphones. Only noise cancelling is something useful otherwise it's waste of money. Packing is also cheap snd also when i exchanged for a new one no accessories were given. It came in a damaged box.

Got this product for my brother. He absolutely loved it. The performance of Noise cancellation is absolutely brilliant. Its even better than Sony h.ear NC Wireless(100-ABN) model, which I primarily use, although the sound in Sony is more fuller.

I got these at a sale for 7,500 rupees. These have very good noise cancelling and a laid back sound signature, which is something I like. They aren't bass heavy and are very balanced. I have a pair of wired Bose QC2s and boy has sound cancelling come a long way. The Bose are good but these are phenomenal.

The sound quality is very good. If you've been using cheaper headphones till now, this will be a noticeable upgrade. Battery life and WiFi range are very good. NC is fine. Not as good as Bose or higher end Sony, but absolutely great for normal usage in trains or offices.

I have tried the models, PMX60, CX180, CX275 on Sennheiser and I must admit that HD 4.50BTNC is the worst of all. Its not worth even 1500 INR but is out in the market for 15,000 INR which is 10x times more than CX 275 which is very durable with a great sound in terms of the bass and voice eq.
Noise cancellation = 3/10
Just received the headphone after two of my friends already bought.
What's good you can find anywhere.

These are not discoverable by a Bluetooth device most of the times. This is my first day of usage of these headphones. Also,the customer support is pathetic and the customer executive when I asked him to place a return request for me.These can only be replaced and not returned as per him...so please buy them at your own risk.

This one I bought for my daughter .. I loved this one after I tested once in Dubai and I liked it at the first sight. And it was in my wish list for a while.. Real noise cancellation head-phone. My daughter really enjoys the clarity and sound quality ..  Battery life is pretty good and I haven't tried, my daughter told she can use wire when the battery is down. She took it in the recent college trip and she told the battery was good enough for 4 days of her trip and 10 hrs of usage daily
I received a defective product & it seems to be a duplicate product. Very bad sound & not contenting with wire. Packing dosent look like a sennheiser original one. Applied for replacement of product.

First of all, note that i made this purchase for half the price during the great indian sale. Secondly, the headphone isn't worth 15k. Now keeping that in mind, this headphone is an absolute beast. The sound quality is really good.....you get that sennheiser classic sound with clear vocals, gread mids and highs, and a punchy bass. It isn't made for bass lovers. I'm a person who prefers decent bass. Sadly the same sound isn't reproduced to this extent when you use the headphone as a wired one(yes they give a 3.5mm cable, a usb 2.0 and a travel pouch in the box). The headphone produces it's best sound only if it's connected wirelessly but i like the option of using it as a wired one too. Battery life is decent, i get anywhere between 28 hours to 36 hours when i use it frequently(again it depends on individual use and preference) with the noise cancellation turned on. And noise cancellation is decent too. Definitely not on Bose level or sony or any other headphones which cost more than 15k. The build feels cheap but flexible and the ear cushions are soft and comfy. Sound can be a little low and has to be atleast 60%-70% to get that great sound. NFC is great! I just tap my phone to the headphone and it gets connected instantly. And the music listening for long hours doesn't hurt either. I listen to EDMs(Trap, Drumstep, Dubstep, House, Future Bass) , pop music as well as aesthetic one like the works of conposers like Hans Zimmer and Danny Elfman. Overall this is worth the price if you purchase it for 7.5k(wait for a sale). These are the best wireless consumer headphones under 10k in my opinion.
I liked sound signature, it was balanced with apt bass mids and highs.
It has amazing battery life very good sound quality.

I got this product for a great deal. The sound quality is really good. I had tried a few online tests, and it was in par with most of the good headphones. The battery life is amazing, something I really loved. The active noise cancellation isn't the best, but best for the price. The Bose headphones are lighter and much comfortable than this, but then they cost you a fortune. The controls are intuitive, except to enable noise cancellation.
The biggest downside of this product is its comfort. I have a smaller than average face and still can’t wear this on for more than 15-20mins as the cups are too hard on your ears.
The noise cancellation on this is almost non existent. It just reduces white noise (things like fan sound etc) a little. All other things are clearly audible and not reduced at all.

Everything is great in it except the bass, it is lacking here. But you will forget it when u will the listen to the sound quality and clarity. Mids and highs are awesome. Voice quality is crystal clear. Noise Cancelation works. Battery life is awesome. It is comfortable for long hours for people with small ears like me, but it is not that much comfortable for people with big ears. Materials used all plastic but a high quality plastic in which u can depend. I got in sale at a price of 7.5k, at this price it is unresistable.

Sound quality is good but noice cancellation is not some out of the world kind of experience yes it does work.. battery life is great hands down... doesn’t really dies once fully charges impressive... the feel n material used seems durable.. knocked it already a couple of times not a scratch... it is easy n comfortable to wear isn’t painful even after wearing for hours...carrying pouch shud have been more durable

What a steal at 50% discount for the wonderful product. Connection to devices for the first time is bit problematic but once you sort that then it is great sound. Should have some display on the headset or the app which would make life easy. CapTune on Android has problems downloading. On Apple devices it was easy.

Got it on sale for 7.5k. As everyone already mentioned in reviews, noise cancelling isn't that great, but good enough to cut down outside noise like 85-90%. Sound is good enough too. Agreed that bass could have been better with this sized drivers. Pretty satisfied with the product for the money I spent.

Not worth the original price of 14k. It's marginally ok of you get it for  a discount, I got it for 7.5k. sound quality is passable. Not very comfortable to wear for long listening sessions. One major concern for me is that it keeps getting disconnected!! and clicks when I listen via Bluetooth. Could't connect via NFC eithet. Beware of buying this product.

This is Good Product but i think sound quality of Skullcandy Headsets are more dynamic, clear and deliver good Bass effects. Like Skullcandy Crusher is less expensive than this product, but delivers very good quality of sound, especially for Bass lovers and for all those who would like to use their BT Headsets with their Bid Screen LCD/LEDs for watching Movies.
The product is great. Sound quality is wonderful.  Slight Hussle in initial understanding of the controls.

This is one of the nicest sounding headphones I have used till date. The audio output is more or less flat, which means that this is not meant for bass lovers. The flat sound profile provides enough room for you to enjoy the mids, lows and highs with ease. The cushioning is also quite good, though I feel the grip in the head could have been a little weaker. Battery life is also superb and if you are light user, th battery will last you for a few days if you are using these regularly for 2 hours a day. Overall, good buy
The product though mentions over-ear, fits more like an on ear headphone.

Probably one of the worst headphones that you can buy for this very price .The item arrived and I was excited about it .and the moment I put them on and started streaming songs ,it was one of the worst experience. The volume at full bar is low .I even tried changing the EQ but it didn’t make any difference . The active noise cancellation was even worse . Didn’t make any difference . I bought them for 8.5k and now I have to go through hurdle of my refund . DO NOT GO FOR THIS HEADPHONE . Waste of money .
I bought it for a discounted price at 7,500 appr. But it feels 7.5 K is even expensive for this headphone.

I feel it is not at all comfortable for long hour listening. Pressure on sides is very much there. You will start feeling uncomfortable after 30 mins or so. Soft padding on headband is  very minimal and not helpful. Though sound and build quality both are good in this price range.

This 4.50 has been getting good reviews for a Noise cancellation headphone...and with the Amazon sale, got it for a great price of 7.5k. Ear pads are a little small for over-the-ear...but not a deal-breaker...great vfm....highly recommended.

Good sound quality and battery life... However, nose cancellation is sub par and head phones are not as comfortable for long usages... Especially for people with bigger ears.... However, considering the price as compared to the gold standard on this in the market, it's good value for money and suffices the need....

The product is superb in terms of durability abd battery backup. The sound quality is very good but not the best in that segment. I would say the sound is quite balanced. However the mic is a let down. The Noise Cancellation is also very good. I got it for 7.5k, so if anyone is getting it for the same price just buy it and don't give a second thought. However 15k is way too high for this.

The nose cancellation is top notch and you will see a perceptible reduction in nose the moment you switch the headphone on. I have been using it for the last 5 days and I just can't stop smiling everytime I use it. Just close your eyes and go for it, it can't get any better than this

Even the slightest movement of you jaw and the your hear creaky pops. Silicone lubrications may help. But maybe the piece I received. Get a hard carry case to extend longevity.

It’s not a bang for your buck, sound is good not the best in business considering these(and price), sennheiser logo started fading after several uses that made me question for it’s quality. Test, try and then buy here if you wish to (considering 50% off amazon gives you sometimes)

Comprehensive Review - Used everyday for 15 Days
Writing this review after two weeks...

I had been waiting for an affordable product in comparison to Bose QC and Sony's noise cancellation head phones. The Sennheiser HD noise cancellation head phones have the right mix of frequencies, a decent cancellation paradigm, a good battery life of around 20 hours, and an excellent wearing comfort. I did not come across the discomfort reported by some user over the ears or the jaw area. Even though it may not have the highest output in terms of volume, the sound quality is decent and represents the lows, mids, and high appropriately. I would certainly recommend this product and seller too, for a prompt well-packaged delivery.
I was the first one who ordered it on sale and then it got out of stock but it again came back.
Noise cancellation is good and active noise guard is really nice for use in busy and noisy places

Was looking for a wireless headset for a while. This is sort of audiphile grade. Love the sound quality. The clarity and mids and lows  are spectacular. I love how the bass is subtle and not overpowering.  Durability is almost perfect. Ergonomics and quality of the buttons are not good. It is reasonably comfortable for 1-2 hours at a stretch. Not as comfortable as the Bose QC 35.  Good headphones for work or to chill. Battery life is great, connectivity is great and does the job well. The noise cancellation is mild at best. Thanks to these headphones I have started listening to a lot of alternative rock.
So i had been waiting for these headphones for a while as I bought these as a birthday gift...
These headphones will cost you some bucks but they will provide quality sound and features.
Great pair of headphones. Good battery life. Adequate noise canceling. Sound quality is quite good as well. No issues in connectivity.

The headphones are great, but they are definitely bulky and seem to get uncomfortable after 30-40 mins of use. The only good competition to this is Bose QC35 - the price of which can buy you two of these headphones. All in all, NFC, pairing, sound quality is all top class; bulkiness being the only con.
Volume is pathetic ...beats or bass is just not there ...my Samsung ear phones performance so much better than  this headset....please don't waste your money on this.  .greatly disappointed.

Sound quality is lower than Sennheiser signature standard but still is better than many products in the price category, however, the biggest drawback is the headband design and the pressure exerted on the ears ! Alas the headband cushioning is inadequate and the band width in the higher end cans is generally twice of this and with better cushioning for longer listening sessions. The pressure in this design on the ears and the adjoining sections is surely more than required, coming close to irritable levels after a short session - probably in the effort to improve noise suppression but this is backfiring as the cans can only be used for about 30 mins and then your ears start crying to take these off. Hopefully Sennheiser can take some corrective action to address this fault to make it a worthy Sennheiser which at present it fails to comply with.

DO NOT buy these for their noise cancellation. Doesn't work, rather just adds a strange hiss to the sound. At best it is noise isolation headphone. This is my second unit of the same SKU - both failed miserably in this aspect. Sound quality varies from OK to good, depending upon the type of music. It's never spectacular though. Battery life is good. Initial pairing can be a pain sometimes. Pixel 2 XL pairing was a breeze, OnePlus 6 just wouldn't connect. Buy these if available on a discount - as a decent enough bluetooth headphone - not as a noise cancelling one though. You get what you pay for.
Fantastic Sound Quality! Amazon has this product at half price during Independence Day sale, came in early too.
What a deal.. Good brand with good sound and decent noise cancellation.
Yes the product is as per what it claimed..

Best in its class. Especially with amazing offers from Amazon. I've had my share of headphones. Couldn't resist checking this out after the price and deals offered. Noice canceling is as good as bose itself. Earmuffs are big but I like it that way. Nice leather finishing with metal and plastic covering gives it class and agility. I'd say definitely a fantastic buy. I still haven't had the charge fully run out. I always travel with it. Five stars and double thumbs up 👍👍
Overall a good overhead ANC headphone.

The sound quality is obviously Sennheiser quality, one of the best.....crisp and true to the music. I have to say im a bit disappointed with the noise cancelling but considering that it comes at the almost $100 cheaper than the Bose or any of its competitors id definitely say its a good buy and kudos to Amazon for the quick delivery and response.

As MRP is ₹14,990 , someone would expect there should be some use of metal in the product. It's totally plastic. Quite comfortable. I don't find kind of difficulties while using the product. Little bit confusing how to enable/disable ANC . Bluetooth range is quite good. As per my test Sound quality is totally balanced. I have purchased this through Amazon freedom sale with super discount

Simply Amazing Music Reproduction. I am comparing the sound quality with Audio Technica and Bose headphones, which I own. But these can reproduce the most balanced music, in wired or bluetooth mode. Two hours of charge gives me more than 12 hours of continuous listening in bluetooth mode. The ANC is not even 50% of what Bose QC 35 can deliver. It is just enough kill ambient sounds and engine drone. Though the Phone earpads are very well made, they can never cover my ears completely and acts as on the Ear phones rather than Over the ear. The padding on the band is flimsy and using the phones for longer period becomes uncomfortable. The Bose QC 35 and Audio Technica with its large earpads and good padding win when it comes to comfort. But again if I have to buy another set of Headphones, simply to listen to music, I will buy these Sennheisers again.
Great sound and perfect balance bass is not on high end but clarity of sound  is best

Amazing sound. Not bass heavy. The vocals are crisp and clear. ANC is good too, no outside noise can be heard. Compared to Bose QC it's still good, but not as comfortable. Overall excellent quality for the price.
Bought these on a whim. Very happy I did in the end.
I extended my budget to buy this headphone, To see how different is ANC.

Writing this review after an extensive use close to a month now. I’ve been using Sennheiser products close to a decade now, the sound quality is really good, I love flat music & it meets my requirement, those bass lovers look somewhere else. Coming to active noise cancelling, it does to some extent, while traveling/commute especially we all Indians know how good the roads are here, it adds it’s own disturbance, it’s good when you are at office or home sitting listening music or movie. Battery is excellent, connectivity is good. Switching on, sometimes take multiple push. If you are thinking to take calls from this, think twice if you are in crowd, it’s not that other person can’t hear you, that person can hear everyone else along with your’s, as this doesn’t have a noise cancelling microphone. Overall not bad if you are at home, office are somewhere calm, which is not it’s overall purpose.

The device in itself is great. Love the Audio quality. Only drawback, was turning the Headset Off when it was in Wireless Mode. For some reason, no matter how long, hard, soft, etc manner of ways you pressed it, there was no guarantee it would turn off. I noticed this Issue was faced mostly when the battery life was less than 6 hours. When it was above that, such occurrences were rare.
Its the best Bluetooth and noise cancellation headphones.The sound clarity is tremendous,The battery life is excellent ,

Work great, use it on my commute in Mumbai and this almost blocks all noise. The battery life is good, one complaint is that the device goes off at about 20%, now I dont wait for it to drain till 20%.

I was in need of a noise cancellation headphones for my work. I came across this and after watching some review videos, I decided to go for it. Here are my initial impressions

While everything about this Sennheiser BT headphones is fantastic, there is only 1 strange problem - if you listening while walking, it creates a thump sound in the ears, and that disturbs your listening experience, and is annoying. This means that I almost cannot hear it while I am taking my walk, which is a strange situation. Otherwise everything is great about this product.

Got during Prime Day sale at 50% off and extra 10% card discount (Rs. 6750). And it's a steal at this price.

Simply put.. unbeatable in its class..Been using d brand since last 10 years and never was displeased wid quality. Now dis pair, like most of dem of dis brand offers neutral sound n I hv to tune my Equalizer to get d type of sound I want. Of course if u want audiophile grade u need to up ur budget. But wid normal ears, u'll b overwhelmed wid d details it produces@113db@1kHz@1Vrms. Bass is not overpowering, but very natural and satisfying n does not feel like out of d world as is belted out in 'some other' company's headphones, where electronic filters suppresses d mid n high frequencies to boost d low (read Bass) frequencies and claim as SUPERBASS or BASSHEADS or Head n Brain CRUSHERS..As said it has dynamic bass, I feel, it tries to adjust as much as possible to d Equalizer setting. Music is lively..More if ur source supports aptX BT codec.. if u want abnormal bass dis is not for u, as it would distort at highest volume wid highest Bass and highest Equalizer setting for LOW FREQUENCIES,since it's diaphragm is PET..In layman's terms, go for it, if u want a near-natural sound, in an Over-ear BT headset, wid balanced low mid n high frequencies sound. If ur upgrading from cheap headphones or d so-called boombassssstic trash den u'll be surprised to hear lot more instruments in it, and pleased to know dat de existed in ur music for all the time u were listening 2 dem in ur previous pairs. U'll fall in love wid dem, just as I have. Got @₹6741/- only in d gr8 freedom sale on Amazon. Thanx to Amazon for such a magical price to such a beautiful piece..I love Sennheiser..But d review was an honest one..widout any partiality..

The sound quality is excellent (crystal clear and undistorted even at the highest volume), pairing these with your device is a breeze, and the overall build quality is impressive, despite the lack of metal and real leather. I have to admit I didn't face any of the fit issues experienced by some here (maybe it has to do with the size of my head/ears), so I have no complaints, really!

I am writing the review after using these really cool closed-back over-ear headsets for the past 15 days.  I must say, these headphones are a damn good entry level buy, in the wireless + ANC game !!  As you may already know, how much expensive good wireless headphones are, but these aren’t that expensive and pack a good punch too. The biggest problem in wireless headphones is that they have bad battery backup but these have super long battery life.

I don't understand if the noise cancellation is turned on or off. I dont think the word Noise Cancellation suits the technology used in this headphones. Especially if you have heard Bose, whatever be the cost difference, this is not at all near the ANC feel. Terrible.

At this price point, they really need to work on sound quality and make it superior. My bose qc25 (wired) are atleast 10 times better in terms of sound. Needed a wireless headphone but compromised on sound quality which I think is not worth it. Build quality and connectivity is good. Average noise cancellation. Overall, good buy for people who have not listened the sound of bose noise cancellation headphone yet!

Though higher at price, it would serve your purpose.

The Headphone is a very good piece, and has a good feel of premium to it. The earcups are a bit hard on the earlobes and could impact a bit of pain to them. They provide average to above average noise cancellation, but still some outside voices sweep in, if you're on the very low volume setting.

After watching a whole lot of video reviews I've been back and forth on this one as I wasn't sure if this product will impress. Fortunately, my friend bought it and his review solved all my fears and doubts. I instantly bought it and voila! The product is by far the best musical experience I've got. I'm not much of a bass lover and loves clear and crisp music and vocals with ample bass. This product is just that! With regard to comfort, it takes at least 2 weeks of usage to get comfort around this product as you may initially feel that it's too tight around your ears. But, once your past that stage, it gets comfy. Yes, I do occasionally have to take it off as it gets a bit heated up and I don't mind it. My verdict, a good investment to evoke our senses!

You can hardly go wrong with a Sennheiser.  I am no audiophile, but to me it sounds just great. Not too bassy.  Feels natural.  The headband is a bit tight, but maybe it will settle into a good fit with use.  Enabling noise cancellation is a bit tricky.  My in-ear Bose NCs are better with noise-cancelling. The Sennheisers let in a bit more of ambient.  In fact for most people the version without NC might be a better proposition.  The padded over-ear pieces by themselves block a lot of external noise.
